comment: Great experience in his class! Lots of lectures, but they are informative and engaging.

I didn't touch the textbook even once and passed. He does prefer to teach the old school style, but it's for the better because you will form a good relationship with him. He provides you with a study guide to help you understand the materials, Overall, Dr. Shelley isone of the most culturally experienced and qualified professors I've ever met.

Dr. Shelley is a very eccentric man and it reflects in his lectures, which I liked about him. He doesn't really use technology so if you can't meet with him in person then you're out of luck. He gives like a crazy amount of extra credit on tests so as long as you attend lectures and study then you're guaranteed a good grade.

Shelley is super old school, his types all his handouts on a typewriter and copy-scans them. He doesn't use D2L at all, so if you don't come to class you won't have a clue whats going on. That being said, his class is pretty straight forward and he has funny old-world mannerisms Made a joke about cocaine on the first day of class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Shelley is an awesome choice! He's very old-schooled and classes are solely lectures. Tests are 100% based on the lectures, so GO TO CLASS. Only Grades by tests, but if you get an A average on the 4 Unit Tests, you're exempt from the Final. He also gives you the study guide for the unit test at the beginning of the unit.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He doesn't penalize you for not showing up, but you HAVE to show up to get notes. He doesn't post anything online. He types tests, study guides, and syllabus on a typewriter. You get exempted from the final if you have an A average on the 4 tests before then, but you have to work & study REALLY hard for it. Great lectures though! I learned SO much!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm a straight A students and I worked my ass off in this class. I studied for four days before the test and all I could get was a low B on each test. I don't get how everyone is saying this class is an easy a. It's the hardest class I've had at Kennesaw. The final is "not cumalative" but it has all material from previous two test. Textbook needed!

He's a nice guy, but this is NOT an easy class. I recommend taking an intro to georgraphy class first. Make sure to buy the textbook, do the study guide and study two weeks in advance. You will get tested on EVERYTHING and I mean EVERYTHING. Don't listen to what other people say. This class requires you to have a lot of background knowledge.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the finest lecturers I've had. Makes geography fascinating and provides a lot of useful information. Hilarious! Makes you laugh all the time. Very clear about everything. Great study guide. I wish I needed more geography classes, I would definitely take him again.

Not sure if he knew how to use a computer. Everything was typed with a typewriter and nothing was posted online. Gave study guides & four equally-weighted (super long/easy) tests. If you make an A average on them, you wont have to take the final. His class was entertaining, not because of the material, but because of the way he taught. TAKE HIM!

You are graded on a few tests that are equally waited and if you get an A average on them you do not have to take the final. He is extremely quirky, he doesn't need notes while teaching and all tests are typewritten. As long as you pay attention, fill out the study guide, and study it thoroughly you should get an A.

Gives study guide on contents of each test. Very easy A! Exempts final test if you keep an A average on first 3 which is very easy as he gives 10+ points extra credit on each test. Material isn't difficult at all and his old charm makes the lectures interesting.

He is like a walking encyclopedia!  Such a nice man and lectures are interesting. It's a very easy class, as long as you take notes. There are 4 exams and you can opt out of the final if you have an A. DO NOT BUY the textbook! I didn't and made over 100 on every test.  Just take notes. There is TONS of extra credit on the exams.

One of the easiest classes to follow. Lots and lots of notes, but well worth showing up for class. Lots of extra credit and if you have an A you can exempt the final. If you don't show up forget making a great grade because he mentions things not in the text. Anyone can easily make an A in his class.

Easiest class in college by far. Old school lecturing style. If you have an A average for your first 4 tests he exempts you from the final. He gives several extra credit questions on all the tests which makes it easy to get A's. If you just go to class and take notes and do the study guide he gives out for the tests you will get an A. Hes funny too
Overall a great class with a great professor.

Really nice professor who knows a lot about Geography.  His lectures were interesting and he'd crack a few jokes here and there. You don't need to buy the book, just study the study guide and go to class. The four test were easy and if you have an A average, you don't have to take the final.

professor shelley is awesome!! he made boring geography class interesting! you don't need the book, he gives out study guides and go over them. he also offers bonus in the test too. just study the study guide you will make an A! we had 4 exams and a final, but if you had an A average on 4 exams you are exempted from the final! TAKE HIM!!
4 easy tests and a final. just show up and you will get an A. All you have to do is study the study guide. don't buy the book or rent it big waste of money. trust me

I had to miss a test and he had no problem with letting me make it up. He is extremely helpful! He tells you everything you need to know for the tests. I made over a 100 and I didn't buy the book. He gives study guides & as long as you study them you'll make an A. He gives GREAT lectures that go along with the study guides. Best professor I've had!

This class is so interesting and Shelley is an amazing professor. I got over 100 on all my tests cause of all the extra credit and didn't have to take the final. Don't get the book it's a waste, just come to class and write what he writes on the board and study his study guide. His teaching style is simple and old school. Also you'll learn so much

This Professor can teach. He gives interesting lectures with bits of humor thrown in and relevant personal experience, so I've yet to have a boring class. If you take good notes (while keeping one eye on the study guide) you won't even need the textbook. He made my semester, if you're taking a geography definitely check him out.

GREAT CLASS! YOU CAN GET AN "A" IF YOU GO TO CLASS,TAKE GOOD NOTES AND COMPLETE THE STUDY GUIDES FOR EACH SECTION. NICE GUY WHO LOVES HIS TOPIC. HE WILL LECTURE THE ENTIRE CLASS SO DO NOT EXPECT TO GET OUT EARLY.  I WOULD TAKE HIM FOR ANOTHER CLASS.
Professor Shelley was by far one of the best professors I've had! His tests come straight from the study guides. He goes over everything. Easy A!

Professor Shelley was one of the best professors I've ever had! He's a walking encyclopedia and is very smart. I loved going to his class and I learned a lot. He throws humor in every now and then and it's very enjoyable! Pay attention in class and take good notes; his reviews are the exact same as the test!

He knows so much about his subject and you can tell he loves it! He well travelled so can tell you a lot about how the countries actually function. There are built in bonus points on his tests which is helpful. His study guides are helpful also. Barely had to open the book. Doesn't use Vista.

Professor Shelley loves what he does. He has traveled many places and is knowledgeable in world geography. He's really clear in his explanations and has great stories. While the book probably isn't absolutely required, you'd have to attend every class to get all the notes. I think I got an A+ because of the book--which is really clear w/great maps.

Prof Shelley is so completely into communicating his knowledge to his classes-- his excitement becomes your excitement as a student.  He has a ton of stories to support his topics and terms so that many things you'll be tested on are associated with some type of story.  He uses additional resources that don't need to be purchased but add a lot.

This class is all about pure memorization.  He gives you clear study guides.  I recommend showing up everyday to know what info he is looking for on test questions.  I would spend around 14 consecutive hours studying the day and night before each test and made an A+ in the class.  If you cant push yourself to study, I would look elsewhere.
You have to memorize a lot of material, but he makes clear what that material is through study guides.
Great class. He is a bit of an odd fellow but he's a good guy. Come to class everyday and the tests are very easy.Don't bother with the book, everything you need is in his lectures.

Awesome class, really recommend it. Study for your tests and you'll do fine. Go to every class though otherwise you will miss A LOT. Tests are very easy and always gives bonus points. Shares interesting stories. Take notes (obvious). Never touched textbook even though he occasionally refers to it.Always willing to answer questions
Robert Shelly is a great teacher 5 tests but if you have an A going into the final you dont have to take it. His tests are very very easy. This is an easy "A".

SUPER easy! Only 4 tests and he gives out study guides. Just go to class and you are sure to pass! He writes notes on the board which are sometimes hard to read..but he's a cute old man! And says different locations funny..I suggest him!
Class was easy (for me).  Gives study guide but on his 2nd test he didn't put almost anything from it on there.  Just go to class and listen, write notes and you will be fine.

This is a awesome professor, very knowledgeable and his class is quite engaging. Test are a bit hard but all you need to do is attend classes, fill in the study guide and actually study. So far I've made an A on each test and hoping to avoide the final. Take him you won't regret

I loved having Shelley. All you need is to attend class and fill out the study guide as he lectures and you will have an A. Gives so many bonus points on every test. Class can be dry sometimes but if you're taking notes you won't even notice. His occasional stories are hilarious - Great class. I would recommend him over anyone at KSU.
Crazy old guy. Extremely knowledgeable. Allows for ridiculous amounts of bonus points on the tests. Go to class, and study for each test for a couple hours, and you'll be fine. Highly recommend.
He is very knowledgeable, class is easy and lectures are very clear, just take good notes and go through the study guide and you will do well.

VERY EASY! Really nice teacher (don't sleep though), pretty funny, attendance was only taken 3 times but only for extra credit on tests; take good notes, tests come STRAIGHT from notes. He gives study guides that are really long but I made sure to know everything on there & never made less than a 102 on a test. Put the work in & you'll get an A.

Shelley is an old-school professor, no class participation or discussion, just straight lecturing. But he gives you everything you need to know so there really is no excuse for failing this class. It's not difficult to make even a 110 on all of the tests, and then he lets you exempt. Just come to class and try your best to stay awake.

His tests come straight from the study guides he gives you. He is extremely knowledgeable. If you study and do well on the tests, you can exempt out of the final. Don't sleep!! He will call you out in it.
Tests are very easy, and he gives a lot of bonus points on each one.

His class is SO easy!  His tests come right from the study guide, you don't really use the book at all in class unless you like studying from it.  Don't sleep in his class, he'll tell you not to come at all.  If you study, you'll do fine.

Shelley is a really nice man but the class can be kind of hard. The only grades are the tests so you HAVE to study. If you go to class and pay attention and study for the tests, you should be ok. The best part of this class was his stories. He didn't tell them a lot but he's really funny when he tells his stories.
outstanding teacher  you will get a good education in this class

Professor Shelly is very good, he knows what he's talking about, I learned a lot in this class, his tests are not hard. I got exempt in the finals, as long as you study, you'll be fine, he gives review test just follow all and you'll do well in the test plus he gives extra credits!!.I l like him a lot!

Awesome awesome teacher. Lectures the entire class but his lectures are so interesting you never get bored. This is the only class I have taken, I actually look forward to going to. He is very very knowledgeable about what he is teaching and mixes in some very interesting personal stories to boot. I feel honored to have taken his class. Great guy!

Awesome teacher!  Knows everything about everything, it seems.  He covers a lot of stuff, so missing a class can be a problem, but I never wanted to miss a class!  Gives lots of opportunities for bonus points, and you can average well over 100's on the tests.  Plus, you can exempt from the final.
I liked the class, he is a good professor. A little redundant but really clear and explain in great details. As long as you go to class and take your note you will pass with flying colors.
Amazing.
He's got a dry sense of humor, but will surprise you with his stories.  He won't let you out of class early but he's a great professor, hands down.

Probably the best prof. at KSU.. he was sooooo funny! I don't know if he is still there, but I would love to have him for all of my classes! It was simple to get an A in his class, just take notes and his tests go over material straight from notes. He is awesome!

Tests come from lectures, so if you miss a class you could be in trouble, he covers a lot of material everyday.He does give you a review sheet before eachst, but they aren't very helpful. He is always willing to answer your questions.  He deffinately knows his stuff and I think he really enjoys just being able to share his knowledge with others.
Absolutely fair teacher. You know what's expected, and if you study you can get an A. Tests cover lots of material and you learn a lot. He is a very nice man.
very good teacher class was very interesting and fun.
He is eccentric.  He is very knowledeable about the subject and manages to keep the class very interesting.  He is straight-forward in his lecture style and clear in his expectations.

I love this guy!!  He is hilarious but at the same time, extremely knowledgable about countries and geography in general.  Very helpful if you're having trouble, too.  Tests are a challenge but very fair.  A great professor!

I loved this guy. I didn't want to take Geo but after having his class I wouldn't mind taking another Geo class with him.  He spent an hour outside of class giving me info for an Iraq debate I was doing. His tests were easy if you studied. Take Shelley-- you won't regret it!

ITA, he is a character. Hilarious little side-notes about countries, very knowledgeable and he's actually been to many of the places he talks about. Now I understand the situation in Iraq and Afghanistan.  A avg. on the first 3 tests = exempt from the final exam. Exams are easy-just study notes/text

He is a character.  Very knowledgeable, but sometimes gives more information than needed for the tests.  Tests are easy if you study the notes, and are mostly multiple choice and matching and maps.  You don't want to miss class because he lectures every day.  He's a fun old guy!
No Comments
